0.Subtitle: The ocean absorbs about 30% of the carbon dioxide (CO2) that is released in the atmosphere.

7.Subtitle: From 1860 the oceansâ€™ pH as fallen by 0.1 pH units, going from 8.2 pH to 8.1 pH.

15.Subtitle: A change of 0.1 means that today the oceans are 30% more acidic, and if we continue at this rhythm, by 2100 they will be 170% more acidic, falling to a pH of about 7.6.

30.Subtitle: In humans, a drop of 0.1 pH units in the blood can result in seizures, coma or even death. It is a small number with huge consequences.
